<ce:section-title id="st015">Synthesis of {[Ag(<ce:bold>L<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>
</ce:bold>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>]·(CF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>SO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)·4H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O}<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0020" view="all">Ag(CF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>SO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>) 0.257<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g (1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in ethanol (10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) was added dropwise with stirring to <ce:bold>L<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>
</ce:bold> (0.292<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in ethanol (10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) and stirring was continued at room temperature for 2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h. Then the reaction mixture was kept in a refrigerator overnight. A white amorphous solid separated out. The solid was collected by filtration, washed with a few drops of methanol and dried at room temperature to give <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> as a white solid in 43% yield. The solid was dissolved in excess ethanol at room temperature, and slow evaporation of this solution yielded colorless block-shaped single crystals that proved suitable for X-ray analysis. FTIR (KBr pellet, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3467(m), 3137(s), 2940(s), 2861(m), 1643(s), 1597(s), 1556(m), 1451(w), 1408(s), 1323(w), 1271(s), 1230(m), 1170(m), 1035(s), 936(m), 820(s), 649(s), 541(w), 458(w), 436(m). <ce:italic>Anal.</ce:italic> Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">37</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">48</ce:inf>AgF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">7</ce:inf>S: C 48.63; H 5.29; N 12.26. Found: C, 48.70; H, 5.22; N, 12.32%.</ce:para><ce:section-title id="st020">Synthesis of {[Cd<ce:bold>L<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>
</ce:bold>(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)(3H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)]·NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O}<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0025" view="all">Cd(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·4H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (308<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in ethanol (10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) was added slowly to a stirred solution of <ce:bold>L<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>
</ce:bold> (292<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in ethanol (10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) and stirring was continued at room temperature for 2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h. The initial white precipitate that formed was filtered off. The filtrate was allowed to evaporate slowly to yield colorless single crystals, one of which was removed from the solution and used directly for X-ray analysis. Yield: 35%. IR (KBr pellet, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3435(w), 3133(m), 2934(w), 1644(w), 1388(s), 1197(w), 1131(w), 982(w), 940(w), 820(w), 702(w), 646(w). <ce:italic>Anal.</ce:italic> Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">18</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">30</ce:inf>CdN<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">11</ce:inf>: C 34.93; H 4.89; N 13.58. Found: C, 34.85; H, 4.82; N, 13.65%.</ce:para>
clean_text:
Synthesis of {[Ag(L1 )2]⋅(CF3SO3)⋅4H2O} n  (1)

Ag(CF3SO3) 0.257g (1mmol) in ethanol (10mL) was added dropwise with stirring to L1  (0.292g, 1mmol) in ethanol (10mL) and stirring was continued at room temperature for 2h. Then the reaction mixture was kept in a refrigerator overnight. A white amorphous solid separated out. The solid was collected by filtration, washed with a few drops of methanol and dried at room temperature to give 1 as a white solid in 43% yield. The solid was dissolved in excess ethanol at room temperature, and slow evaporation of this solution yielded colorless block-shaped single crystals that proved suitable for X-ray analysis. FTIR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3467(m), 3137(s), 2940(s), 2861(m), 1643(s), 1597(s), 1556(m), 1451(w), 1408(s), 1323(w), 1271(s), 1230(m), 1170(m), 1035(s), 936(m), 820(s), 649(s), 541(w), 458(w), 436(m). Anal. Calc. for C37H48AgF3N8O7S: C 48.63; H 5.29; N 12.26. Found: C, 48.70; H, 5.22; N, 12.32%.

Synthesis of {[CdL2 (NO3)(3H2O)]⋅NO3⋅2H2O} n  (2)

Cd(NO3)2⋅4H2O (308mg, 1mmol) in ethanol (10mL) was added slowly to a stirred solution of L2  (292mg, 1mmol) in ethanol (10mL) and stirring was continued at room temperature for 2h. The initial white precipitate that formed was filtered off. The filtrate was allowed to evaporate slowly to yield colorless single crystals, one of which was removed from the solution and used directly for X-ray analysis. Yield: 35%. IR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3435(w), 3133(m), 2934(w), 1644(w), 1388(s), 1197(w), 1131(w), 982(w), 940(w), 820(w), 702(w), 646(w). Anal. Calc. for C18H30CdN6O11: C 34.93; H 4.89; N 13.58. Found: C, 34.85; H, 4.82; N, 13.65%.
